chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Tieana L Rimmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 
27 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Seek and maintain full time employment at the discretion of the Probation agent.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Respect all law enforcement officers.
Successfully complete Anger management program.
Participate in Parenting classes.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tieana L Rimmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Failure to Meet Conditions for Expungement, filed. aj

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   

Sentencing proceeded.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statements by Milwaukee Police Officer Rochelle Gawin.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 100 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 27 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobritety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Respect all law enforcement officers.
*Seek and maintain full time employment at the discretion of the Probation agent.
*Successfully complete Anger management program.
*Participate in Parenting classes.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Restitution is set at $0 (zero).

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revoked, by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony or misdemeanor, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement. 

- Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Tieana L Rimmer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
filed.  Attempt Midemeanor Battery contrary to sec. 940.19(1), 939.51(3)(a), 939.32 Wis. Stats.  a Class A Misdemeanor.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defense counsel requests Projected guilty plea and sentencing date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.
Court ordered cash bond of $200.00 be converted to signature bond in the amount of $200.00.    Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Tieana L Rimmer not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tieana L Rimmer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Tieana L Rimmer in custody.  Ronald Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tieana L Rimmer in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Tieana L Rimmer in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Tieana L Rimmer not in court.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/14/15 @ 1:30pm
